list_definition.definition: freedom from pain or from worry or hard work

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He passed his exam with ease.
We were impressed by her ease of manner.

list_definition.definition: to free from pain, trouble or anxiety

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A hot bath eased his tired limbs.

list_definition.definition: (often with off) to make or become less strong, less severe, less fast ease

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The driver eased off as he approached the town.

list_definition.definition: to move (something heavy or awkward) gently or gradually in or out of position

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: They eased the wardrobe carefully up the narrow staircase.

The global budget was eased to some extent in 1987, which has led to relative cost increases since that time.

Finally, the ambiguity of universal service eased eligibility extension and benefit expansion.
A semblance of conformity with the imperial constitution also eased the task of rallying princes to his project.
